title: Assembler
job_description:
We have an incredible opportunity for a dynamic Assembler to join our growing New York Team!   

About DO & CO   
We have a passion for hospitality culinary delights on every banquet floor and in the sky. With the three business segments of Airline Catering, International Event Catering, and Restaurants, Lounges & Hotels, we offer gourmet entertainment all over the world. We operate in 32 locations, 12 countries and 3 Continents, maintaining the highest standard of quality in both our products and services. We refine the classics, develop the unknown and grow constantly – sometimes beyond our own expectations.   

What We Offer:  

  • Pay rate: $19.75 hourly.
  • Daily Complimentary Meals (Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner).
  • An organization dedicated to fostering innovation; in pursuit of cultivating creativity, embracing new ideas and leveraging our impeccable standard for hospitality.
  • Genuine career development opportunities, both nationally and internationally.
  • The chance to collaborate and represent a leading force in the luxury global gourmet entertainment industry.

Responsibilities:  

  • Pull and stack products according to daily order requirements.
  • Regularly monitor product quality and promptly report any issues to ensure safety standards are met.
  • Inspect items and conduct inventory checks as assigned.
  • Receive, store, and assemble equipment and supplies in accordance with airline specifications.
  • Ensure the correct quantity of equipment and beverages is accurately packed and prepared for each flight.
  • Verify all stock received and replenished is properly documented.
  • Perform additional duties as assigned by management while upholding DO & CO’s quality and safety standards.

Qualifications:  

  • Proactive and self-organized, with the ability to manage a substantial workload.
  • Capable of working independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment.
  • Able to complete assigned tasks efficiently and meet strict deadlines.
  • Must have a flexible schedule, including availability to work evenings, overnights, and weekends.
  • Must be able to lift, push, pull, and move products, equipment, and supplies weighing up to 75 pounds.

Diversity & Inclusion Statement   
DO & CO provides equal employment opportunities. Applicants will be considered for employment without discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, disability status or any other protected characteristic.

title: Assembly Technician
job_description:
Podium Automation is a venture-backed, early-stage startup based in Brooklyn, NY reimagining the way we design and manufacture industrial control panels. Our vision is to create a new industrial supply chain to unblock critical hardware innovation across sectors and industries.

We are seeking an Assembly Technician to join a nimble, fast-paced team at the front lines of our factory, building and testing industrial control panels. You will have the opportunity to work in a variety of different operations from enclosure modification through wiring through final testing. As Podium iterates and implements new technologies, you will work hand-in-hand with the engineering team to both operate and test the new methods and equipment, while providing feedback and suggestions to help continually improve our production process.

What You’ll Do

  • Modify enclosures to include cutouts for panel mounted devices.
  • Drill and tap panel backplanes per drawings provided by the engineering team
  • Retrieve components from stockroom and help maintain stockroom inventory levels
  • Mount components to the panel and wire them together
  • Complete inspection procedures to ensure panels were assembled correctly
  • Assist with preparing completed panels for shipping, and helping load/unload goods from trucks when needed.
  • Test new methods and operate prototype automated equipment to help improve the speed and quality of the panels Podium builds, and provide constructive and detailed feedback.

Who You Are

There are 4 values that all Podium employees are expected to demonstrate (albeit imperfectly):

  • Customer Obsession: We sit on the same side of the table as our customers and build things to solve their biggest problems
  • High Integrity: We strive to be honest, transparent, and kind. We do the right thing even when it's not the easy or obvious path, and believe that how things get done is just as important as what gets done.
  • Have Grit: We pick up the broom and have a bias for action. We enjoy doing things outside of our comfort zone, and we roll up our sleeves and take on those challenges head-on.
  • Win and Lose as a Team: We work collaboratively and take primary fulfillment from the team’s success. While we certainly celebrate individual achievements, we ultimately win as a team.

Required for this role

  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • Mechanically inclined and experience doing light sheet metal modification work (drilling and tapping holes, knockouts for conduits, cutting openings for panel mounted devices)
  • Attention to detail in following written instructions
  • Understanding of electrical fundamentals (AC vs DC voltage, function of overcurrent protection devices, sizing of wiring)
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office
  • Able to work on your feet 8 hours/day
  • Able to lift items that are 25 lbs
  • Available to work in-person in Brooklyn, NY Monday through Friday.

Preferred for this role

  • Experience working in a UL 508A panel shop or with industrial control panels
  • Familiar with DTM, E3, EPLAN, or AutoCAD Electrical

Job Types: Full-time, Temp-to-hire

Pay: $25.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • Dental insurance
  • Health insurance
  • Life insurance
  • On-the-job training
  • Paid time off
  • Vision insurance

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Overtime

Supplemental Pay:

  • Overtime pay

Ability to Commute:

  • Brooklyn, NY 11205 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

  • Brooklyn, NY 11205: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Shipping & Receiving / Assembler Associate
job_description:
A Brooklyn Navy Yard Development Corporation business is seeking a Shipping & Receiving/ Assembler Associate to join the team at our warehouse facility to help with shipping and receiving, product assembly, and product testing.

Responsibilities:  
– Prepare packages for shipment  
– Receive shipments promptly into our system  
– Generate accurate shipping labels and documents  
– Work with a team to assemble and test products  
– Help maintain a clean and orderly work area

Ideal Qualifications:  
– Previous experience in shipping / receiving, pick and pack, manufacturing, fabrication, assembly or other related fields  
– Very comfortable using email and workflow management programs on a computer  
– Enjoy working hands on with electronics  
– Attention to detail  
– Ability to meet deadlines  
– Strong work ethic

This is a full time position starting ASAP with the opportunity to transition to full time with benefits.

Pay is a competitive entry level rate.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $22.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental insurance
  • Health insurance
  • Vision insurance

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Ability to Commute:

  • Brooklyn, NY 11205 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Woodworker / Assembler for Manufacturer
job_description:
Hiring Woodworker / Assembler for our Brooklyn manufacturing facility.

At least 5 years of woodworking experience is required.

Both wood and metal material to be handled.

Familiarity with woodworking is a MUST.

Equipment handling and shop experience is a must.

CNC experience is a plus.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Feed raw materials into production machinery
  • Sand and paint material
  • Carry out basic quality and testing checks.
  • Finish components and inspect finishes.
  • Operate power and hand tools.
  • Assemble goods.
  • Store goods and raw materials properly in our warehouse.
  • Maintain work areas and equipment.

Please send your resume with references.

Thank you!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $21.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person
